reviewText:
Set loose in the wild west as a gunslinger out for revenge, traveling towards the safety of the frontier while saving damsels in distress, looting gold and killing as many bad guys as possible. How cliche.. but FUN!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GaC531nSO3w
Equipped with a basic pistol you slowly work through the levels collecting loot for purchasing and upgrading of weapons along with boosting base attribute points. Weapons included a range of pistols, rifles and shotguns that all had procedurally generated stats. Levels are generally segmented into arenas, clearing each area reopened invisible barriers allowing further progression until eventually facing mini-boss fights. Each boss used alternate weapons, attack patterns and insults.

Comedy wise it's quite good, bit of a shame there was no voice-work. With a decent little story it really would have added to the overall immersion but the soundtrack and artstyle are very spaghetti western and do a wonderful job on their own. Control wise both kb+mouse and gamepad was suitable and responsive, while all the keyboard controls were able to be remapped

With co-op support, decent price point and tight twin-stick western shooter action, can easily give Wild Frontera the big thumbs up. Did not have a chance to try co-op but I'm sure that would only be more enjoyable. Cheers folks. :)
voteText: 39 of 54 people (72%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText: Wild Frontera offers some incredibly fun gameplay and is a solid Western shooter, unapologetically cliché and a non-stop chaotic adventure. While it's a little on the short side and could benefit from some voice acting, fans of top-down shooters and games with a Wild West setting are in for a treat.

This is no twin stick shooter by any traditional means.\n\nThey want you to be so deadly accurate with the aiming. reviewText:
This would be a great Twin Stick Shooter if they had of put some effort into tweeking the sensitivity for the joysticks... or if they even had of put it in the options menu for the user to config...

If you dont mind using the Keyboard and Mouse then this makes for a great game.... but again making a twin stick shooter that is better with a mouse ?

I still have to recommend this however because what ever you use to play it is still a challenging game and looks good as well.

reviewText:
Can't recommend this one I'm afraid. I liked the graphic style and it was close to being good, but it failed on a few fronts. Finished the game in 2 hours, and it spent most of that 2 hours annoying me.

- Most deaths feel due to bad design rather than something I should have seen
- No pause function
- The night levels have really low contrast, so you can't see anything
- Took me 5 stages to realise there was a dodge button
- The guns feel sluggish
- Confined spaces make it hard to avoid getting cornered
- Frequently killed by things I couldn't see
voteText: 10 of 12 people (83%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
I'm really on the fence about this one. It has good audio and visuals, some good arena fights, and a decent array of weapons to keep things interesting. Unfortunatelythe loose gamepad controls that turn it from challenging to frustrating, and generally ruin an otherwise good game. Using the mouse and keyboard make the controls much tighter, but my I prefer using twin sticks to control a twin stick shooter.

Maybe a couple updates will fix the issues I have with it, but until then I can't really recommend it unless you prefer the mouse/keyboard controls for this type of game.

Edit: clarifying the control issues are with gamepads, not keyboard/mouse.

reviewText:
My First Play on Launch Day Video + First Impressions Review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gHkOtaQG5tM

This game offers an eye-pleasing game experience and it shows that the developers took a lot of time on the attention to detail with the levels and art-style of this game.

However, while the art style is well done, the action is reletentless and never slows down, I wish the developers had spent a little more time paying attention to the actual gameplay itself.  The fluidity and responsiveness of the game seems to be lacking that of the top-notch twin stick shooter games, and it gives the game an overall little bit of sluggish feel that brings down my over-all first impressions score from what I feel it could" have been with just a little more work.

I like that up to 4 players can play online co-op
date: but I think i was the first one to buy and play this game so that aspect wasn't able to be tested at the time of this early review.\n\nThe game is challenging early on
hoursPlayed: and the controls aren't horrible by any stretch
voteText: they are pretty good
helpfulPercent: but certainly not nearly as crisp and responsive as I like to see twin stick shooters like this.\n\nWith the developers stating about a 2.5 hour expected play through
votesHelpful: and then having to wait for additional content and game modes or playing the game again at an 'extreme" difficulty level
votesTotal: it's hard for me to see a ton of value in this game even at the low initial price point of $9.99 USD.\n\nStill
votesFunny: I believe the game is pretty fun
commentsCount: with pretty good (just not great) controls
column16: and it does offer an eye-catching western beauty style that I enjoy myself.  It it certainly good enough to make me wish it was just a little bit better.\n\nMy overall first impressions review based on Stage 1 play solo play...  72% (out of 100)"

reviewText:
A lively, cinematic twin-stick shooter where the bullets fly thick but not fast - this is less of a murderous twitch" shooter than some more arcadey titles.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iYj8ze2GqUs
Good points:

- Strong storytelling and sense of place where you can really taste the horse.
- You're straight into the action
date: get quick restarts and always have a feeling of progression without it being too easy.\n- It's funny
recommended: full of nice touches and hidden bonuses.\n- It continually adds new enemy types
hoursPlayed:
raising the stakes at every corner

Bad points:

- Some annoying one-hit kills that seem to come out of nowhere
- The arenas sometimes feel like they go too long before they release you
- Doesn't feel as tight and precise to control as you'd like
- I walked into a mantrap every two minutes

Conclusion:

Fairly short but sweet arena-based fun with a great atmosphere."
voteText: April 21, 2015
